pr_title: 11851 Enable messaging features for Jakarta EE9

timeline.message: 11851 Enable messaging features for Jakarta EE9
11851 Enable messaging features for Jakarta EE9
11851 Enable messaging features for Jakarta EE9

timeline.bodyText:
This is an internal feature common across each of the public messaging features, right?
Does there need to be a separate private API feature (io.openliberty.jakarta.messaging.3.0) for other components to pull in just the API ... or should they use the api bundle directly?
timeline.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: Oddly no, not at this time.  Features that require the messaging api declare a dependency on this internal feature.  I can certainly add the API feature and modify the internal feature dependency.  Although the new API feature would be nearly vestigial, maintaining this feature pattern will facilitate serviceability and devOps.
replies.author: dazavala

replies.bodyText: That would be fine if this feature only pulled in APIs needed for Messaging... but it also pulls in connectors internals and transactions.
replies.author: tevans78

replies.bodyText: No problem!  I meant "maintaining the api-specific feature pattern ...".  The change is uploaded.  Note that a feature specific to the javaee/javax jms api does not exist in previous releases.
replies.author: dazavala

replies.bodyText: "This" is the feature, messaging-3.0.  The verb is now changed to enables rather than includes.
replies.author: dazavala

+ supported only on JDK 8 or later. It enables access to the messaging engine that is enabled \

replies.bodyText: I'm finding that SIB terms are either all capitalized or all lower case.  All are now capitalized.
replies.author: dazavala

timeline.bodyText: io.openliberty.jakarta.connectors-2.0 should be the only feature you need here as it pulls in io.openliberty.connectors-2.0.internal
timeline.author: KyleAure
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.messaging-3.0.internal
+singleton=true
+IBM-App-ForceRestart: uninstall
+IBM-API-Package: jakarta.jms; version="3.0"; type="spec"
+-features=io.openliberty.jakarta.messaging-3.0, \
+ io.openliberty.jakarta.connectors-2.0, \
+ io.openliberty.connectors-2.0.internal, \

replies.bodyText: Looking at the feature descriptors, io.openliberty.jakarta.connectors-2.0 provisions the API bundle, only.
replies.author: dazavala

timeline.bodyText:
messagingClient-3.0 should not be able to co-exist with wasJmsClient-2.0
Is it enough to mark this as a singleton, or is there something else required (like supersedes) to ensure that these two features should clash?
A similar consideration is required for all the renamed features.
timeline.author: joe-chacko

replies.bodyText: The dependency on private feature com.ibm.websphere.appserver.eeCompatible-9.0 will ensure that messagingClient cannot be configured with any javaEE[6..8]-compatible feature.  Same for the other messaging features.  At server startup when the feature resolver detects such a configuration it will create a singleton conflict.  The feature manager will then log the conflict as an error specific to javaee+jakartaee feature incompatibility and remove the conflicting features from list of features to provision.
replies.author: dazavala

timeline.bodyText: As mentioned elsewhere, please can we make this 3.0 instead of 2.0?
timeline.author: joe-chacko

timeline.bodyText: As mentioned elsewhere, please can we make this 3.0 instead of 2.0?
timeline.author: joe-chacko

replies.bodyText: Yes, we've the green light on bumping all jakarta messaging features to version 3.0.
replies.author: dazavala

timeline.bodyText: I note that elsewhere in this set of changes, a file has been changed solely to add a trailing newline. By that token, does this also need one?
timeline.author: joe-chacko

replies.bodyText: We can ignore the newline.  Other file(s) indicate a newline difference because I either added or removed a newline while resolving merge conflicts.
replies.author: dazavala
